amendment.description: Amendment limits to $75-$125 per hour the rate which court-appointed attorneys may receive to represent defendants in Federal death penalty cases.
amendment.purpose: An amendment to require federal judges to limit to $75-$125 per hour the rate which court-appointed attorneys may receive to represent defendants in death penalty and habeas corpus appeal cases. Additionally, the amendment requires public disclosure by the court of amounts awarded in fees and expenses.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Bryant (TN) amendment (A008) Agreed to by voice vote.
